reviews.text: This parador is situated right on the edge of the gorge, and most rooms have simply spellbinding views. The location is right at the foot of the bridge between Old and New Ronda, meaning walking distance to everything. The Plaza de Toros is right next door, as is a TI (Turismo booth).
reviews.title: Spectacular site, great staff!

reviews.text: The rooms are modern and clean, not old, frumpy, or rustic in any way as some of the other paradors are. Big french doors open onto small semi-private balconies... did I mention the view?
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — the beautiful rooms and the unbeatable views

reviews.text: The staff in this parador is exceptionally friendly and flexible.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Ronda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant at the parador was terrific - one of the better ones in 8 days in Spain. Again, fantastic service - more refined yet warmer than the other paradors.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No complaints whatsoever - wouldn't stay anywhere else in Ronda!
reviews.title: Great location but not much else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, close to the bars and restaurants of Ronda. We had a superior room which had a balcony and stunning views across the valley. Would definitely recommend opting for a room with a view. Breakfast wasn't included in the rate so didn't try the food there. All in all a nice hotel with big, airy rooms.
reviews.title: Great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ronda was the second stop of our 9 day Andalusian trip - I've written reviews of the other hotels as well. I was looking forward to Ronda the most because of everything I'd read... especially because of the expected views.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Ronda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't disappointed. The views from this hotel, and our room, were beyond breathtaking. I've never been in a more picturesque setting (I used up an entire camera memory card and had to buy another one across the street from the hotel) than what we found here in Ronda, and at the Parador.
reviews.title: Perfect birthday treat.

likes.disliked: — Bit expensive especially for winter rates.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can afford it, get one of their two-story "duplex" rooms. Well worth the added price; it was like staying in a spacious, luxurious townhome with the best views possible. We had two seperate balconies overlooking the bridge and the gorge, with beautiful views to be seen right from our bed. Bathrooms (there were two!) were everything I could have wanted, and the bed was very comfortable (only a double though) and backed by a beautiful antique-looking headboard. In all, simply perfect. I would have moved into that room, and into Ronda, in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Great location, very spacious rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the buffet breakfast at the hotel was excellent - highly recommend, especially if you get up late as we did and miss the more formal sit-down affair.
reviews.title: Great setting

reviews.text: Had a great lunch out on the back terrace overlooking the gorge. Try the partridge pate!
reviews.title: Afraid of heights but still loved it

reviews.text: Spent two nights at this hotel in March and liked the hotel very much. It is in a stunning location on the side of the cliff affording views over the countryside to the mountains beyond, yet in the town so it is possible to walk from the Parador and see all Ronda has to see.
reviews.title: A comfortable hotel in a stunning location. We were not disappointed.

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a "duplex" room, sitting room and shower room downstairs and bedroom/bathroom upstairs. The bed was enormous and comfortable, and the view wonderful. The balcony upstairs had reclining chairs, and table and chairs, and was very private. We were not disturbed by noise at night. Some of the furnishings were getting a little worn out, but that did not detract from the space, privacy and comfort of this room.
reviews.title: Best spot in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at the Parador in Ronda. Our rooms were huge and elegantly decorated. The bathrooms were opulent and cavernous. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The view from our french doors was eye-popping and took in the gorge and bridge connecting the old and new sections of the city. As for the sewage smell wafting up from the gorge written about in this forum, it was detectable, but not overwhelming. We encountered the same smell all over Spain, including Barcelona. Apparently, their sewage engineering has some catching up to do. I would not miss the wonderful experience of seeing Ronda and staying at this elegant hotel. It's the best address in Ronda.
reviews.title: Stay at the Parador in Ronda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of their new build ones in the vestiges of the old town hall - not an old castle or anything so don't expect any of that. But it is by miles the best in town with all the usual Parador sumptuousness and quality (though sometimes rather grumpy) of service. There are great views - pay the extra for a superior room - the restaurant is good and the bar and other public rooms as swish as usual. Don't bother - never bother - with 12 euros worth of Parador breakfast, the cafes in town are about a tenth the price and far more fun.
reviews.title: New build Parador so not so typical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ronda is a popular day trip from the coast, and tends to attract a rich variety of visitors, but here you've got a lovely retreat from all that carry on at any time of day.
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.disliked: — If you can, just turn up and ask if they can give you a promotional rate. This saved us 60 Euros for one nights stay.

reviews.text: This hotel is excellent and I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Comfortable, central and great views

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had a bad experince at another hotel near by and walked into the Parador to ask if they had availability that night. This worked to our advantage because I enquired if they could give us a special to which they obliged and we had a double room with breakfast for 90 Euros!! The usual rate is 150 Euros I think.
reviews.title: The Only Place To Stay In Ronda
